title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: In August 2010, the blog became a licensed feature of The New York Times online and was renamed FiveThirtyEight: Nate Silver's Political Calculus. In July 2013, ESPN acquired FiveThirtyEight, hiring Silver as editor-in-chief and a contributor for ESPN.com; the new publication launched on March ...

title: FiveThirtyEight joins ABC News - ABC News
snippet: ABC News announced today it has reached an agreement in principle to acquire the renowned data journalism organization FiveThirtyEight from ESPN.

title: Publishers Daily: ABC News Buys 'FiveThirtyEight'
snippet: FiveThirtyEight, which covers sports, politics and science, will continue to provide data-driven sports coverage to ESPN, which just sold it to ABC. The new ownership means FiveThirtyEight will expand its political coverage under ABC News.

title: Why did ABC News acquire FiveThirtyEight? - Quora
snippet: Answer (1 of 2): Short answer: Because ESPN needed to sell FiveThirtyEight, and no one outside the Disney umbrella was willing to pay a high enough price. ESPN had been looking at divesting itself of Nate Silver’s brand for at least a few months now. TheBigLead (a sister publication to USA Toda...

title: Nate Silver’s FiveThirtyEight Moving From ESPN To ABC News
snippet: Nate Silver’s data-driven news site FiveThirtyEight is changing teams, with ABC News saying it has reached an agreement in principle to acquire the site from its Disney corporate sibling ESPN.
